commands.name: amp_get_computers
commands.description: Returns a list of computers on which agents are deployed. You can use filters (arguments) to narrow the search.

commands.name: amp_get_computer_by_connector
commands.description: Returns information for the specified computer.

commands.name: amp_get_computer_trajectory
commands.description: Returns a list of all activities associated with a particular computer. This is analogous to the Device Trajectory on the FireAMP Console. Use the Q argument to search for an IP address, SHA256 hash, or URL.

commands.name: amp_get_computer_trajctory
commands.description: Returns a list of all activities associated with a particular computer. This is analogous to the Device Trajectory on the FireAMP Console. Use the Q argument to search for an IP address, SHA256 hash, or URL.

commands.name: amp_move_computer
commands.description: Moves a computer to a group with the corresponding connector_guid and group_guid, respectively.

commands.name: amp_get_computer_activity
commands.description: This endpoint enables you to search all computers across your organization for any events or activities associated with a file or network operation, and returns computers that match the specified criteria. You can then query the /computers/{connector-guid}/trajectory endpoint for specific details.

commands.name: amp_get_computer_actvity
commands.description: This endpoint enables you to search all computers across your organization for any events or activities associated with a file or network operation, and returns computers that match the specified criteria. You can then query the /computers/{connector-guid}/trajectory endpoint for specific details.

commands.name: amp_get_events
commands.description: A general query interface for events. This is analogous to the Events view on the FireAMP Console.

commands.name: amp_get_event_types
commands.description: Events are identified and filtered by a unique ID. This endpoint provides a human readable name and short description of each event (by ID).

commands.name: amp_get_application_blocking
commands.description: Returns a list of application blocking file lists. You can filter this list by name

commands.name: amp_get_file_list_by_guid
commands.description: Returns a particular file list for application blocking or simple custom detection. You need to specify the file_list_guid argument to retrieve information about a particular file_list.

commands.name: amp_get_simple_custom_detections
commands.description: Returns a list of simple custom detection file lists. You can filter this list by detection name.

commands.name: amp_get_file_list_files
commands.description: Returns a list of items for a particular file_list. You need to specify the file_list_guid argument to retrieve these items.

commands.name: amp_get_file_list_files_by_sha
commands.description: Returns a particular item for a given file_list. You need to specify the sha256 argument and the file_list_guid argument to retrieve an item.

commands.name: amp_set_file_list_files_by_sha
commands.description: Adds a SHA256 hash to a file list, using file_list_guid.

commands.name: amp_delete_file_list_files_by_sha
commands.description: Deletes an item from a file_list using the SHA256 hash and file_list_guid.

commands.name: amp_get_groups
commands.description: Returns basic information about groups in your organization. You can map group names to GUIDs for filtering on the events endpoint.

commands.name: amp_get_group
commands.description: Returns a particular group

commands.name: amp_set_group_policy
commands.description: Sets a security policy to a group of endpoints.

commands.name: amp_get_policies
commands.description: Returns a list of policies. You can filter this list by name and product.

commands.name: amp_get_policy
commands.description: Retrieves information about a particular policy, based on policy_guid.

commands.name: amp_get_version
commands.description: Fetches a list of versions.

commands.name: amp_delete_computers_isolation
commands.description: Performs a feature availability request on a computer. Can also be used as a course-grained isolation status request.

commands.name: amp_put_computers_isolation
commands.description: Request Isolation for a Computer.  If a computer is already isolated a 409 Conflict error status will be sent. Returns the same result of a GET request on the /isolation endpoint.

commands.name: amp_get_computers_isolation
commands.description: Returns a fine grained isolation status for a computer.  The available flag is set to true if isolation can be performed on the computer.  status will be set to one of:  not_isolated pending_start isolated pending_stop

1.0.1.releaseNotes:
#### Integrations
##### Cisco AMP
- Fixed an issue where the `amp_move_computer` command would fail.

1.0.2.releaseNotes:
#### Integrations
##### Cisco AMP
- Fixed an issue where commands would fail due to a syntax error caused while created their query parameters.

1.1.0.releaseNotes:
#### Integrations
##### Cisco AMP
- Added the following commands.
  - ***amp_delete_computers_isolation***: Requests to unlock a computer.
  - ***amp_put_computers_isolation***: Requests to lock a computer.
  - ***amp_get_computers_isolation***: Returns the isolation status of a computer.
